page.title: 13TRAVEL AROUND HOUSTON
page.content: Houston is very much a commuter settlement. Few live and work in the community. Many travel to work by car. The village is so widespread that life without a car would be difficult. Weekly shopping is bought in Johnstone,Paisley and Renfrew with Bridge of Weir useful for smaller regular purchases. These towns plus Greenock,Glasgow and Bishopton(M.O.D.) provide most workplaces. New roads have been built in Houston but no improvements have been made to link roads to nearby towns. The rush hour traffic load is therefore becoming considerable, causing anxiety about safety. The only rail link,i.e.Glasgow to Kilmacolm was closed recently. There is an hourly bus service with an express to Glasgow recently introduced.
